author: mklement0
body:
`Get-Date` already supports _output_ date formatting via `-Format`, but it would also be handy to allow passing date/time _strings_ along with an _input_ format string so as to allow from-string conversion, say via:

* adding an `-InputFormat` parameter
* adding a `-Culture` parameter (which could be used in insolation or combined with `-InputFormat`)
* changing the `-Date` parameter type to `[object]` so that users can pass strings as well.

```powershell
# The following would be the equivalent of:
#   [datetime]::ParseExact('19-06-2018', 'dd-MM-yyyy', $null)
PS> Get-Date -Date '19-06-2018' -InputFormat 'dd-MM-yyyy' # wishful thinking

Tuesday, June 19, 2018 12:00:00 AM

# The following would be the equivalent of:
#     [datetime]::Parse('19-06-2018', [cultureinfo] 'de-DE')
PS> Get-Date -Date '19-06-2018' -Culture de-DE # wishful thinking 

Tuesday, June 19, 2018 12:00:00 AM
```

A note re culture-sensitive behavior:

Due to an inconsistency, when `Get-Date -Date` is currently passed a _string_, that string is (implicitly) converted to a `[datetime]` instance in a culture-_sensitive_ fashion - whereas in most other to-and-from string conversions PowerShell by design applies the _invariant_ culture - see #6989.

For instance, the following actually currently works while culture `de-DE` is in effect, even though it arguably _shouldn't_:

```powershell
# !! Works with [cultureinfo]::currentculture = 'de-DE', for instance.
Get-Date -Date '19-06-2018'
```



Environment data
----------------

Written as of:

```powershell
PowerShell Core v6.1.0-preview.2
```
title: Add support for parsing date strings to Get-Date
